body_html:
There are two places to configure remote session with tf.ConfigProto

  1. when you create a session with remote master: tf.Session("grpc://",
    config=...)
  2. when you launch remote master: tf.train.Server(config=...)

Docs says that tf.train.Server(config=...) specifies "specifies default
options for all sessions that run on this server."
Does this mean that tf.Session("grpc://", config=config) settings are
ignored?

On Tue, Sep 20, 2016 at 11:56 AM, Jianmin Chen notifications@github.com
wrote:

Do you have it set by some previous sessions in the same process?
// Note that the first Session created in the process sets the
// number of threads for all future sessions unless
use_per_session_threads is
// true or session_inter_op_thread_pool is configured.

—

body:
There are two places to configure remote session with tf.ConfigProto
1. when you create a session with remote master: tf.Session("grpc://",
config=...)
2. when you launch remote master: tf.train.Server(config=...)

Docs says that tf.train.Server(config=...) specifies "specifies default
options for all sessions that run on this server."
Does this mean that tf.Session("grpc://", config=config) settings are
ignored?

On Tue, Sep 20, 2016 at 11:56 AM, Jianmin Chen notifications@github.com
wrote:

> Do you have it set by some previous sessions in the same process?
> // Note that the first Session created in the process sets the
> // number of threads for all future sessions unless
> use_per_session_threads is
> // true or session_inter_op_thread_pool is configured.
> 
> —
